definition: Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

sentences.english: Anyone who wants to be a politician is already dishonest.
sentences.chinese: 想要成为政客的任何人都是不清正廉明的。

sentences.english: Mike: No, really, why are you so sure politicians are dishonest?
sentences.chinese: 不，真的，你为什么那么确定政客都不清正廉明？

sentences.english: "Incorruptibility and cleanness are the lifelines of the Red Cross' work in China," Hua said.
sentences.chinese: “清正廉洁是中国红十字会工作的准则，”华建敏说。

sentences.english: Kato and decided to send QuanJiangShu to light sea king there.
sentences.chinese: 加藤清正决定将劝降书送到光海君那边。

sentences.english: He is seen as the mirror of honesty and uprightness.
sentences.chinese: 他被视为清正廉洁的典范。

sentences.english: Democratic election urges officials to keep honest.
sentences.chinese: 民主选举，有利于督促干部保持清正廉洁。

sentences.english: In China's history, there are many honest and upright people.
sentences.chinese: 在中国的历史上，有许多清正廉洁的人。

sentences.english: This paper elaborates on the American experience of building administrative ethics and its enlightenment to China.
sentences.chinese: 政府保持清正廉洁是构建和谐社会的重要因素。

definition: to secure a position/to take an official appointment
self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly
Aimin district of Mudanjiang city 牡丹江市, Heilongjiang
